articles.title: Droupadi Murmu Is India's New President
articles.description: India got its first tribal President yesterday as NDA choice Droupadi Murmu scooped up over 60 per cent of the total vote value. Opposition's Yashwant Sinha conceded defeat after three rounds of counting. The President-elect will take oath on July 25
articles.content: <li>Droupadi Murmu got 64.03 per cent of total vote value after three rounds of counting. Yashwant Sinha ended up with 35.97 per cent. Ms Murmu received 2,824 votes with a value of 4,83,299. Mr Sinha… [+2765 chars]

articles.title: College students host lip-lock challenge in Karnataka, one arrested
